verses.verse: (Interlude: Where Wisdom Is Found) “Surely there is a mine for silver and a place for gold to be refined.
(Deut 8.9) Iron is taken out of the earth, and copper is smelted from ore.
Miners put (Heb He puts) an end to darkness and search out to the farthest bound the ore in gloom and deep darkness.
They open shafts in a valley away from human habitation; they are forgotten by travelers; they sway suspended, remote from people.
(Ps 104.14) As for the earth, out of it comes bread, but underneath it is turned up as by fire.
Its stones are the place of sapphires, (Or lapis lazuli) and its dust contains gold.
“That path no bird of prey knows, and the falcon’s eye has not seen it.
The proud wild animals have not trodden it; the lion has not passed over it.
(Deut 8.15; 32.13) “They put their hand to the flinty rock and overturn mountains by the roots.
They cut out channels in the rocks, and their eyes see every precious thing.
The sources of the rivers they probe; (Gk Vg: Heb bind) hidden things they bring to light.
(vv 23, 28) “But where shall wisdom be found? And where is the place of understanding?
(Prov 3.15) Mortals do not know the way to it, (Gk: Heb its price) and it is not found in the land of the living.
The deep says, ‘It is not in me,’ and the sea says, ‘It is not with me.’
It cannot be gotten for gold, and silver cannot be weighed out as its price.
It cannot be valued in the gold of Ophir, in precious onyx or sapphire. (Or lapis lazuli)
(Prov 8.10; 16.16) Gold and glass cannot equal it, nor can it be exchanged for jewels of fine gold.
(Prov 3.15; 8.11) No mention shall be made of coral or of crystal; the price of wisdom is above pearls.
(Prov 8.19) The chrysolite of Cush cannot compare with it, nor can it be valued in pure gold.
(vv 23, 28) “Where then does wisdom come from? And where is the place of understanding?
It is hidden from the eyes of all living and concealed from the birds of the air.
(Job 26.6) Abaddon and Death say, ‘We have heard a rumor of it with our ears.’
(vv 23–28) “God understands the way to it, and he knows its place.
(Ps 33.13; Prov 15.3) For he looks to the ends of the earth and sees everything under the heavens.
(Job 12.15; Ps 135.7) When he gave to the wind its weight and apportioned out the waters by measure,
(Job 37.3, 6, 11, 12; 38.25) when he made a decree for the rain, and a way for the thunderbolt,
then he saw it and declared it; he established it and searched it out.
(Deut 4.6; Ps 111.10; Prov 1.7; 9.10) And he said to humankind, ‘Truly, the fear of the Lord, that is wisdom; and to depart from evil is understanding.’ ”
